00001 /*
00002 cencoder.c - c source to a base64 encoding algorithm implementation
00003 
00004 This is part of the libb64 project, and has been placed in the public domain.
00005 For details, see http://sourceforge.net/projects/libb64
00006 */
00007 
00008 #include "b64/cencode.h"
00009 
00010 void base64_init_encodestate(base64_encodestate* state_in)
00011 {
00012         state_in->step = step_A;
00013         state_in->result = 0;
00014         state_in->stepcount = 0;
00015 }
00016 
00017 char base64_encode_value(char value_in)
00018 {
00019         static const char* encoding = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789+/";
00020         if (value_in > 63) return '=';
00021         return encoding[(int)value_in];
00022 }
00023 
00024 int base64_encode_block(const char* plaintext_in, int length_in, char* code_out, base64_encodestate* state_in)
00025 {
00026         const char* plainchar = plaintext_in;
00027         const char* const plaintextend = plaintext_in + length_in;
00028         char* codechar = code_out;
00029         char result;
00030         char fragment;
00031 
00032         result = state_in->result;
00033 
00034         switch (state_in->step)
00035         {
00036                 while (1)
00037                 {
00038         case step_A:
00039                         if (plainchar == plaintextend)
00040                         {
00041                                 state_in->result = result;
00042                                 state_in->step = step_A;
00043                                 return codechar - code_out;
00044                         }
00045                         fragment = *plainchar++;
00046                         result = (fragment & 0x0fc) >> 2;
00047                         *codechar++ = base64_encode_value(result);
00048                         result = (fragment & 0x003) << 4;
00049         case step_B:
00050                         if (plainchar == plaintextend)
00051                         {
00052                                 state_in->result = result;
00053                                 state_in->step = step_B;
00054                                 return codechar - code_out;
00055                         }
00056                         fragment = *plainchar++;
00057                         result |= (fragment & 0x0f0) >> 4;
00058                         *codechar++ = base64_encode_value(result);
00059                         result = (fragment & 0x00f) << 2;
00060         case step_C:
00061                         if (plainchar == plaintextend)
00062                         {
00063                                 state_in->result = result;
00064                                 state_in->step = step_C;
00065                                 return codechar - code_out;
00066                         }
00067                         fragment = *plainchar++;
00068                         result |= (fragment & 0x0c0) >> 6;
00069                         *codechar++ = base64_encode_value(result);
00070                         result  = (fragment & 0x03f) >> 0;
00071                         *codechar++ = base64_encode_value(result);
00072 
00073                         ++(state_in->stepcount);
00074                 }
00075         }
00076         /* control should not reach here */
00077         return codechar - code_out;
00078 }
00079 
00080 int base64_encode_blockend(char* code_out, base64_encodestate* state_in)
00081 {
00082         char* codechar = code_out;
00083 
00084         switch (state_in->step)
00085         {
00086         case step_B:
00087                 *codechar++ = base64_encode_value(state_in->result);
00088                 *codechar++ = '=';
00089                 *codechar++ = '=';
00090                 break;
00091         case step_C:
00092                 *codechar++ = base64_encode_value(state_in->result);
00093                 *codechar++ = '=';
00094                 break;
00095         case step_A:
00096                 break;
00097         }
00098         *codechar++ = '\n';
00099 
00100         return codechar - code_out;
00101 }
